turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Unfinished creative work.
turn.2: Between 1982 and 1996, he published twelve volumes of "The History of Middle-earth", a substantial portion of which is unfinished and incomplete drafts.
turn.3: Was any of his work published?
turn.4: In 2007, Christopher Tolkien published another novel from his father entitled "The Children of Húrin".
turn.5: What were some of his more famous writings?
turn.6: Like "The Silmarillion", Christopher assembled the novel from various incomplete drafts.
turn.7: Why did he leave some of his writings unfinished?
turn.8: The size of a project can be such that a piece of literature is never finished.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Geoffrey Chaucer never completed "The Canterbury Tales" to the extensive length that he originally intended.
turn.12: Chaucer had, however, already written much of the work at the time of his death, and the "Canterbury Tales" are considered to be a seminal work despite the unfinished status.
